paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One LQT2 line carries a heterozygous trafficking-deficient variant in the hERG channel, namely the KCNH2-p.A561V variant.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with trafficking deficiency.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to LQT2 and has been studied in hiPSC-CMs.
key_quotes: One LQT2 line carries a heterozygous trafficking-deficient variant in the hERG channel, namely the KCNH2-p.A561V variant.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A third LQT2 line, used for optical mapping experiments, has been previously described and is carrying the KCNH2-p.A614V variant.

functional_data.summary: The variant results in both trafficking defect and altered channel inactivation properties.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to LQT2 and has been studied in hiPSC-CMs.
key_quotes: A third LQT2 line, used for optical mapping experiments, has been previously described and is carrying the KCNH2-p.A614V variant.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A second LQT2 line carries the branch point mutation KCNH2-IVS9-28A/G, which disrupts the acceptor splice site definition of intron 9 and was associated with trafficking deficiency.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with trafficking deficiency.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is linked to LQT2 and has been studied in hiPSC-CMs.
key_quotes: A second LQT2 line carries the branch point mutation KCNH2-IVS9-28A/G, which disrupts the acceptor splice site definition of intron 9 and was associated with trafficking deficiency.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of pathogenic variants investigated in the study

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant KCNH2 variants were extracted with detailed penetrance data.
